channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13036] Meta scanner should use its own threadpool
item.description: Currently, during region location lookups, the meta is scanned and for this the scanner submits a request to the thread pool of the table in question. Sometimes, it might happen that many scan requests are simultaneously submitted on the table - let's say 256, and this is the max size of the thread pool. Each of these scan requests would in turn submit meta scan requests on the same thread pool, but they will be in the queue. The meta scans will not happen and the original table scans would lock up. The meta scans should use a different thread pool.
item.summary: Meta scanner should use its own threadpool

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch for master that replicates the behavior of the batchPool in ConnectionManager and creates a metaLookupPool.

This message is automatically generated.

Will 5 threads max for the meta lookup pool be sufficient? Why 5?

Do we need the core size to be 5? Why not 1?

Is this only a problem in branch-1 or later do you think? Seems something relevant to 0.98 also. If so, please consider putting the additional test somewhere other than TestMetaWithReplicas for an easier backport.

Andrew Purtell, this issue doesn't affect 0.98. It only affects branch-1+. In those branches, the scans uses the table's thread-pool for executing the scans. Also, in those branches, the meta lookup can happen on replicas of the meta (if the appropriate configs are enabled). In a replicated-meta setup, the number '5' is assumed as the max number of replicas by default (unless it is configured to be of a higher value). In a non-replicated-meta setup, only one thread would be active.
Thanks. Please add comments as to what the magic constants mean, then lgtm

More threads!

Patch follows pattern we have elsewhere: i.e. meta ops have dedicated resources. Patch LGTM.
